text: Bottle sample at a tasting at troubles place. Thanks Tom L. Hazy golden. Aroma of fruity esters, bubblegum, fruity and herbal hops, sweetish, slightly tart, yeast, a bit floral, bitterish finish, medium-bodied. Nice.
At Drors place, pours yellow with a small head, aroma of peach, lemon, flavor is bitter with peach, bubblegum, lavender, medium bodied
Bottle. Clear golden, moderate white head. Aroma: wheat, spice, hops. Light to medium body. Dry grainy taste with nice hoppy accent. Citrus, tropical fruit. Light bitterness. Fine beer.

Definitely can smell the wheat and hops in the nose. Pours as a nice amber color with a small white head. Love the flavor. Traditional wheat taste up front with a hoppy finish. Very drinkable and smooth.

Golden to pale body with low head. Aroma has citrus character, earthy, hoppy overall. Taste has high citrus bitterness with lingering earthy, almost vegetal aftertaste. Body is full, high carbonation.

This is one of my new favorite beers. A filtered wheat beer with hoppy overtones. Neither overpowers the other, very balanced. Has tons of fruit and spice flavors coming out in the beer. Banana and cloves to name a few.

Love this beer! Pours a pale amber color. A perfect balance of hoppy and wheat beers. Initial taste gives you that hefeweizen banana and clove taste, and it finishes with a great citrus hoppy flavor. Surprisingly clean finish for combining these two styles.
The bitter is really small, strong taste of a citrus mix. It is really close to IPA but there are much more fruits there.
Verry interesting light citrus aroma. Soft, sweet, spicy, malt taste and medium bitter.
Golden, low lingering head. Aroma citrusy, wheat, cereals. Palate medium, low carbonation. Taste fruity and straightforward, balanced, fresh tasting. Very nice.
Bottle, from zlý časy. Hazy golden colour. Small white head. Aroma is weizeny, cloves, hops, citrus fruits. Taste is typical weizeny, and hops. Very drinkable. Good.
Bottle at Zly casy. Very interesting and very tasty. Classic weizeny character combines well with assertive hops presence. Fruity, clove, tasty, great. Very tasty, very good.

Cans and Beer, Moscow tap: pours copper with a white head. Aroma is light citrus and malts. Taste is kind of citrusy and a tad sweet. This beer is confusing because you just expect every beer in Russia to be an IPA. This is also not a real kristalweizen. Hard to say what it is.
Somewhat hazy brass colour. Perfectly sized and creamy head. Aroma is orange rind, tamarind, and some savoury spices. Taste is pretty well spiced.
Orange colour, white head. Aroma of orange, mandarin, grapefruit, lemon, bread. Taste is light sweet, light bitter a bit tart. Light body, slick texture, average carbonation.
Bottle. Clear yellow gold. Aroma: very fruity, citrus, tropical, passion fruit and papaya. Taste: pleasant, soft, fruity, citrus and tropical, light sweetness.

500ml bottle from Bochka in Moscow. Label is different to the one here - psychedelic like their Atomnaya Prachechnaya IIPA. Pours almost clear orange with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma of grapefruit and lemon. Taste is fruity with spices followed by a soft bitter finish. Initially I was a bit disappointed because I thought this would be a traditional Kristallweizen. It seems more like an APA to me.

Bottle. Clear orange color with thin unsteady head. Aroma is very nice: lime, grapefruit and maybe even gooseberry. Taste is lightly sweet, spicy notes and some bitterness in the end. Well balanced. Finish is long enough, dry. Decent blend of weizen and IPA.
Впервые знакомл& со стилем, ничего конкрет& сказать не смогу, однако понрави& и аромат, и достато& прямой и контрек& как грудь второго размера, вкус.

the aroma is malty and fruity with shades of orange, spicy grasses and banana... the taste is fruity and spicy with notes of sweet orange, yeast, spruce, mango and lichee... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...
